match.title: 3rd ODI
match.statusText: Bangladesh won by 9 wickets (with 83 balls remaining) (D/L method)

image.caption: An overview of the Zohur Ahmed Chowdhury Stadium
image.longCaption: An overview of the Zohur Ahmed Chowdhury Stadium, Bangladesh A v England, March 7, 2010

match.hoursInfo: 15.00 start, First Session 15.00-18.30 Interval 18.30-19.15, Second Session 19.15-22.45

headshotImage.longCaption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Litton Das b Rubel Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Jean-Paul Duminy c Litton Das b Rubel Hossain 51 (70b 3x4 0x6 99m) SR: 72.85

dismissalComment.html: Duminy perishes off the final ball. The Bangladesh players get together. Goodish length and slides away outside off with the angle, Duminy throws his bat at it and skies it. Litton Das judges it well at point and swallows it

dismissalText.long: c Sabbir Rahman b Mashrafe Mortaza
dismissalText.commentary: David Miller c Sabbir Rahman b Mashrafe Mortaza 44 (51b 5x4 0x6 57m) SR: 86.27

dismissalComment.html: Mashrafe gets to 200 ODI wickets and breaks the stand! Back of a length and outside off, Miller wants to cut it away. He hits it in the air, Sabbir dives full-length to his right and pouches a sharp catch at backward point. He makes amends for dropping Amla earlier in the day at mid-off

Shakib strikes and reaches 199 ODI wickets. Tossed up full and drifts on off, Faf du Plessis folds low for a sweep but he does not connect with it properly. He skews it into the air off a thick top edge. Mushfiq moves forward and across to his left as he settles under it

And Amla becomes Shakib's 200th ODI victim.. Shakib gives this more air outside off. This one drifts in and then turns away to mess with Amla's attempted drive. He only feathers an edge behind to Mushfiq. Amla can't push on after being reprieved..

Behardien holes out to long-on! Looped up on middle, he runs down the track and punts it towards long-on. The fielder snaps up an overhead catch, but realising that the momentum would carry him over the ropes, Sabbir holds his balance, tosses the ball in the air, and takes it on the rebound

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Mustafizur strikes and Chittagong roars.. Fuller and slides in with the angle, Qdk wants to whip it away over the leg side but does not connect. Mustafizur shoots through the gate and hits the leg stump. The bails get tipped off.

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: The Mustafizur cutter consumes Rabada. This one grips in the pitch and hoodwinks Rabada, who gets forward and does not connect with the drive. Sneaks through the bat-pad gap and hits middle and off

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Quinton de Kock b Mustafizur Rahman 7 (8b 1x4 0x6 11m) SR: 87.5

dismissalComment.html: Mustafizur strikes and Chittagong roars.. Fuller and slides in with the angle, Qdk wants to whip it away over the leg side but does not connect. Mustafizur shoots through the gate and hits the leg stump. The bails get tipped off.

dismissalText.long: c Mushfiqur Rahim b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Faf du Plessis c Mushfiqur Rahim b Shakib Al Hasan 6 (17b 0x4 0x6 22m) SR: 35.29

dismissalComment.html: Shakib strikes and reaches 199 ODI wickets. Tossed up full and drifts on off, Faf du Plessis folds low for a sweep but he does not connect with it properly. He skews it into the air off a thick top edge. Mushfiq moves forward and across to his left as he settles under it

dismissalText.long: c Mushfiqur Rahim b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla c Mushfiqur Rahim b Shakib Al Hasan 15 (35b 2x4 0x6 62m) SR: 42.85

dismissalComment.html: And Amla becomes Shakib's 200th ODI victim.. Shakib gives this more air outside off. This one drifts in and then turns away to mess with Amla's attempted drive. He only feathers an edge behind to Mushfiq. Amla can't push on after being reprieved..

dismissalText.commentary: Rilee Rossouw c Mushfiqur Rahim b Mahmudullah 17 (27b 2x4 0x6 37m) SR: 62.96

dismissalComment.html: Rossouw has been given out caught behind by umpire Gough as South Africa slip to 50 for 4. Rossouw and Miller converge and decide against a review. Looped up on off, grips in the pitch, keeps a bit low and spins away. Rossouw's balance is shot as he goes for a pull and nicks it behind via a bottom edge. Mushfiq swallows his third catch and Rossouw drags himself off the field..

dismissalText.long: c Sabbir Rahman b Mashrafe Mortaza
dismissalText.commentary: David Miller c Sabbir Rahman b Mashrafe Mortaza 44 (51b 5x4 0x6 57m) SR: 86.27

He hits it in the air, Sabbir dives full-length to his right and pouches a sharp catch at backward point. He makes amends for dropping Amla earlier in the day at mid-off

dismissalText.long: c Sabbir Rahman b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Farhaan Behardien c Sabbir Rahman b Shakib Al Hasan 12 (16b 1x4 0x6 24m) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: Behardien holes out to long-on! Looped up on middle, he runs down the track and punts it towards long-on. The fielder snaps up an overhead catch, but realising that the momentum would carry him over the ropes, Sabbir holds his balance, tosses the ball in the air, and takes it on the rebound

dismissalText.commentary: Kagiso Rabada b Mustafizur Rahman 1 (5b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 20

dismissalComment.html: The Mustafizur cutter consumes Rabada. This one grips in the pitch and hoodwinks Rabada, who gets forward and does not connect with the drive. Sneaks through the bat-pad gap and hits middle and off

dismissalText.commentary: Kyle Abbott b Rubel Hossain 5 (10b 0x4 0x6 13m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: bowled'em.. Rubel spears a yorker right in the blockhole. Abbott sits back and wants to hack it to the leg side but does not connect. Rubel nails the middle stump. The umpire checks for a front-foot no-ball. Rubel is okay.

headshotImage.longCaption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Litton Das b Rubel Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Jean-Paul Duminy c Litton Das b Rubel Hossain 51 (70b 3x4 0x6 99m) SR: 72.85

dismissalText.commentary: Soumya Sarkar c Amla b Imran Tahir 90 (75b 13x4 1x6 107m) SR: 120

dismissalComment.html: soft, soft end to a powerful innings. No century for Soumya. South Africa hardly celebrate. He shakes his head ruefully as he trudges back. He looks to drive this flighted ball and ends up chipping it into the hands of Amla at short cover

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal not out 61 (77b 7x4 0x6 114m) SR: 79.22

dismissalComment.html: soft, soft end to a powerful innings. No century for Soumya. South Africa hardly celebrate. He shakes his head ruefully as he trudges back. He looks to drive this flighted ball and ends up chipping it into the hands of Amla at short cover

dismissalText.commentary: Soumya Sarkar c Amla b Imran Tahir 90 (75b 13x4 1x6 107m) SR: 120

dismissalComment.html: soft, soft end to a powerful innings. No century for Soumya. South Africa hardly celebrate. He shakes his head ruefully as he trudges back. He looks to drive this flighted ball and ends up chipping it into the hands of Amla at short cover

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: Bangladesh take their fourth series in a row. Might have been an attempted googly. Dragged down, Litton skips back and pulls it over midwicket to spark celebrations in Chittagong!

commentPostTextItems.html: Mashrafe collects the trophy and hands it over to Soumya. Chittagong raises itself to a massive roar. Do come back for the Test series. Until then, this is Deivarayan Muthu, saying ta ta.

Mashrafe Mortaza: After losing the first match, it was difficult to come back in the second. The boys played brilliantly in the third match. The way Soumya was batting was nice to see. Mustafiz has become a very good fast bowler. Tamim showed his character as well. It was brilliant. The boys have got some confidence and also I would thank South Africa. Thanks to the crowd, keep supporting us.

Hashim Amla: Very disappointing, indeed. We misjudged the conditions but credit to Bangladesh. We were rusty and we haven't played good cricket. We have got a good idea of what the wickets would be. Test cricket is a different ball game. We will regroup and come back in the Tests. The Test guys have flown in.
Soumya Sarkar is the Man of the Match and the Man of the Series.

10:57pm Litton plucks out a stump as a souvenir. Chandika Hathurusingha hugs Tamim Iqbal. Another big series win for the hosts - their first bilateral series win over South Africa. Mashrafe jumps onto Heath Streak.

After the bowlers stifled South Africa with a combination of seam and spin, Tamim and Soumya shaved 104 runs off the target in 16 overs. Soumya propelled the chase with 90 off 75 balls, unfurling a panoply of strokes, including a ramp right over the keeper's head. Imran Tahir had some crumbs of comfort with the wicket of Soumya but Litton finished the chase with a pulled four with 83 balls to spare.
Tamim: Beating South Africa is a huge moment for Bangladesh. Soumya batted beautifully. Beating South Africa is not an easy task. Winning is a habit and we have trust that we can beat any team.
Abu Obaida Imon: "5-0 against ZIM, 3-0 against PAK, 2-1 against IND & 2-1 against SA. 4 consecutive series win ."
Srinivasan: "You said 4th straight series win. What was the first team..?" -- Zimbabwe

commentTextItems.html: flighted and on off, he nips down the track and forces it over the covers

headshotImage.caption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: another leg-side wide
slid down leg, wide
tucked from off to deep square leg
looped up and outside off, pokes and misses
quicker and shorter outside off, latest of late-cuts it to the right of short third man
cracker of a hit! Full and outside off, down the track, makes room and thumps it over the covers. One-bounce four
good length and on middle, mistimes a drive to the left of the bowler off the inside half of the bat
googly ducks back in, Litton does not pick it. He plays and misses, taking it on the thigh

headshotImage.caption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: darted full and slides on off, too close to cut. Chopped behind the wicket

dismissalText.commentary: Soumya Sarkar c Amla b Imran Tahir 90 (75b 13x4 1x6 107m) SR: 120

commentTextItems.html: soft, soft end to a powerful innings. No century for Soumya. South Africa hardly celebrate. He shakes his head ruefully as he trudges back. He looks to drive this flighted ball and ends up chipping it into the hands of Amla at short cover
full on the stumps, wristy drive to the covers
length ball just a shade outside off, blocked off the back foot

commentPreTextItems.html: Aditya : "K Rabada - First 10 overs in international Cricket 10 overs 30/8. Next 10 overs 67/0."

commentTextItems.html: straight ball on middle, bunted to the covers
pitched up and outside off, secures a single to deep third man

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: Soumya makes room. Full and wide outside off, flashes and misses
back of a length and on middle, knocked to midwicket
back of a length and on middle, blocked

commentPostTextItems.html: Mayank Agarwal: "Sarkar targeting a well deserved century here!!"

commentTextItems.html: back of a length and on the hips, picked away to short fine leg

dismissalComment.html: soft, soft end to a powerful innings. No century for Soumya. South Africa hardly celebrate. He shakes his head ruefully as he trudges back. He looks to drive this flighted ball and ends up chipping it into the hands of Amla at short cover

headshotImage.caption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Soumya Sarkar c Amla b Imran Tahir 90 (75b 13x4 1x6 107m) SR: 120

dismissalComment.html: soft, soft end to a powerful innings. No century for Soumya. South Africa hardly celebrate. He shakes his head ruefully as he trudges back. He looks to drive this flighted ball and ends up chipping it into the hands of Amla at short cover

South Africa: 100 runs in 27.3 overs (166 balls), Extras 3

Drinks: Bangladesh - 131/0 in 20.0 overs (Tamim Iqbal 46, Soumya Sarkar 73)
Tamim Iqbal: 50 off 70 balls (5 x 4)
Bangladesh: 150 runs in 22.6 overs (138 balls), Extras 12

milestones.description: Tamim Iqbal has scored 37 fifty-plus scores in ODIs, the most for BAN breaking Shakib's record
Shakib has scored 6 hundreds in ODIs, the most for BAN breaking Tamim Iqbal's record

stories.title: Bangladesh v South Africa, 2015
stories.subTitle: 3rd ODI, Chittagong
stories.seoTitle: Wisden Almanack review: Bangladesh v South Africa, 2015
stories.summary: Wisden's review of the third ODI, Bangladesh v South Africa, 2015

stories.title: Bangladesh go from inadequacy to audacity
stories.subTitle: South Africa in Bangladesh 2015
stories.seoTitle: Bangladesh go from inadequacy to audacity
stories.summary: For several years, Bangladesh batsmen struggled against the short ball. Then, one day, Soumya Sarkar ramped a bouncer over the keeper's head and forever changed the definition of Bangladesh's periscope

image.caption: Soumya Sarkar misses the ramp
image.longCaption: Soumya Sarkar misses the ramp, Bangladesh v South Africa, 2nd T20I, Mirpur, July 7, 2015

stories.title: Dreams of beating big teams now a reality - Mashrafe
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Chittagong
stories.seoTitle: Dreams of beating big teams now a reality - Mashrafe
stories.summary: Bangladesh's captain Mashrafe Mortaza and players have said they are ecstatic at bouncing back from the defeat in the first ODI to win the series against South Africa 2-1

image.caption: Shakib Al Hasan is congratulated by team-mates after he dismissed Hashim Amla
image.longCaption: Shakib Al Hasan is congratulated by team-mates after he dismissed Hashim Amla, Bangladesh v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Chittagong, July 15, 2015

stories.title: Were South Africa too clever for their own good?
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v SA, 3rd ODI, Chittagong
stories.seoTitle: Were South Africa too clever for their own good?
stories.summary: In the name of rotation, they left out far too many players than was perhaps needed, and without a calming influence, the team lacked proper direction

image.caption: AB de Villiers opened the innings for the South Africans
image.longCaption: AB de Villiers opened the innings for the South Africans, BCB XI v South Africans, Fatullah, July 3, 2015

stories.title: Dominant Bangladesh complete historic series win
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Chittagong
stories.seoTitle: Dominant Bangladesh complete historic series win

image.caption: Tamim Iqbal and Soumya Sarkar during their strong opening stand
image.longCaption: Tamim Iqbal and Soumya Sarkar during their strong opening stand, Bangladesh v India, 1st ODI, Mirpur, June 18, 2015

stories.title: Shakib, Mashrafe complete 200 wickets
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v SA, 3rd ODI, Chittagong
stories.summary: Stats highlights from Bangladesh's historic victory against South Africa in Chittagong

image.caption: Tamim Iqbal guided Bangladesh to a series win with a 77-ball 61
image.longCaption: Tamim Iqbal guided Bangladesh to a series win with a 77-ball 61, Bangladesh v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Chittagong, July 15, 2015

stories.title: Bangladesh's old heads come through
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v SA, 3rd ODI, Chittagong
stories.summary: The final ODI came down to a battle of experience; while Mashrafe Mortaza calmly marshaled his troops, South Africa were left in the shade whenever they needed a lift

image.caption: Shakib Al Hasan is congratulated by team-mates after he dismissed Hashim Amla
image.longCaption: Shakib Al Hasan is congratulated by team-mates after he dismissed Hashim Amla, Bangladesh v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Chittagong, July 15, 2015

stories.title: Amla in a pickle, and Sabbir's juggle
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v SA, 3rd ODI, Chittagong
stories.seoTitle: Amla in a pickle, and Sabbir's juggle
stories.summary: Plays of the day from the third ODI between Bangladesh and South Africa in Chittagong

image.caption: Hashim Amla drives the ball through the off side
image.longCaption: Hashim Amla drives the ball through the off side, Bangladesh v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Mirpur, July 12, 2015

stories.title: Bangladesh seal series with nine-wicket win
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v SA, 3rd ODI, Chittagong
stories.seoTitle: Bangladesh seal series with nine-wicket win
stories.summary: Rain put the brakes on but could not drown out Bangladesh's chances of beating South Africa for the first time in a bilateral ODI series and recording a fourth successive series win at home

image.caption: Soumya Sarkar struck a 75-ball 90
image.longCaption: Soumya Sarkar struck a 75-ball 90, Bangladesh v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Chittagong, July 15, 2015

stories.title: History asks Bangladesh batsmen to step up
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Chittagong
stories.seoTitle: History asks Bangladesh batsmen to step up
stories.summary: If they can come good in one more ODI, they will win a series against South Africa and claim another entry into great performances in Bangladesh cricket history. If they don't, it wouldn't be the end of the world

image.caption: Mushfiqur Rahim works the ball through the off side
image.longCaption: Mushfiqur Rahim works the ball through the off side, Bangladesh v South Africa, 1st ODI, Mirpur, July 10, 2015

stories.title: This is a big opportunity for us - Shakib
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v SA, 3rd ODI, Chittagong
stories.seoTitle: This is a big opportunity for us - Shakib Al Hasan
stories.summary: With the three-match series against South Africa tied 1-1, Bangladesh have a chance to complete their third bilateral ODI series win in 2015 and Shakib Al Hasan has little doubt about the importance of the occasion

image.caption: Shakib Al Hasan celebrates the wicket of David Miller
image.longCaption: Shakib Al Hasan celebrates the wicket of David Miller, Bangladesh v South Africa, 1st T20 international, Mirpur, July 5, 2015

stories.title: South Africa confront conflicting priorities
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v SA, 3rd ODI, Chittagong
stories.summary: With the ODI series on the line, South Africa face a selection quandary, needing to balance giving everyone a run with going for a win

image.caption: Quinton de Kock made a 31-ball 44
image.longCaption: Quinton de Kock made a 31-ball 44, Bangladesh v South Africa, 2nd T20I, Mirpur, July 7, 2015

stories.title: Bangladesh eye third straight ODI series win
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v SA, 3rd ODI, Chittagong
stories.seoTitle: Bangladesh eye third straight ODI series win
stories.summary: Two one-sided matches, with the teams batting first folding for identical scores and losing by big margins, have given the third ODI at the Zahur Ahmed Chowdhury Stadium the status of a final
stories.byline: The Preview by Mohammad Isam in Chittagong

image.caption: Hashim Amla wonders what went wrong
image.longCaption: Hashim Amla wonders what went wrong, Bangladesh v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Mirpur, July 12, 2015

videos.title: 'We were outplayed in all departments' - Duminy
videos.subTitle: Bangladesh v SA, 3rd ODI, Chittagong
videos.seoTitle: 'We were outplayed in all departments' - Duminy
videos.summary: JP Duminy conceded that Bangladesh were the better team in the series, but that South Africa were looking to end the tour on a high with victory in the Tests

videos.title: Bangladesh's fourth consecutive bilateral series win
videos.subTitle: Bangladesh v SA, 3rd ODI, Chittagong
videos.seoTitle: By the numbers - Bangladesh's fourth consecutive bilateral series win
videos.summary: Bangladesh won their fourth bilateral series in a row after they thrashed South Africa in the third ODI

videos.title: 'We are up for the challenge' - Tahir
videos.subTitle: Ban v SA, 3rd ODI, Chittagong
videos.seoTitle: 'We are up for the challenge' - Tahir
videos.summary: Imran Tahir feels that South Africa have already put their loss to Bangladesh in the second ODI behind them and will put their best foot forward in the series decider at Chittagong

videos.title: Are South Africa missing AB de Villiers?
videos.subTitle: Bangladesh v SA, 3rd ODI, Chittagong
videos.seoTitle: Are South Africa missing AB de Villiers?
videos.summary: South Africa and Bangladesh have all to play for in the last ODI with the series tied 1-1, Mohammad Isam talks about what both sides need to secure the series
